AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: Court where trial was held and made oral findings of fact regarding the constitutionality of a stop and search, applying the Brignoni-Ponce standard
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: law enforcement agency involved in border surveillance, control, and immigration inspections, with agents operating on roving patrol and making stops based on reasonable suspicion
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.5th Circuit Court of Appeals: a court that held principles for investigatory stops, specifically articulating the Brignoni-Ponce standard
